answers.answer: Refugees from Ukraine under temporary protection in Romania are eligible for various social benefits outlined by specific laws and ordinances, including minimum inclusion income, parental leave, childcare allowance, and humanitarian support.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/social-benefits-for-refugees and read the page carefully.

answers.answer: Beneficiaries may access different types of support depending on their individual circumstances and legal status.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/social-benefits-for-refugees and read the page carefully.

answers.answer: Mothers who gave birth after April 12, 2024, are eligible for support, and applications must be submitted no later than 3 months after the child's birth.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/social-benefits-for-refugees and read the section under 'Support for mothers with newborns'.

answers.answer: Applications, along with copies of the required documents, should be submitted to the Social Assistance Directorate of the city where the mother resides.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/social-benefits-for-refugees and read the section under 'Support for mothers with newborns'.

answers.answer: The social voucher provided electronically for mothers with newborns is worth 2,000 RON.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/social-benefits-for-refugees and read the section under 'Support for mothers with newborns'.

answers.answer: Single parents or guardians caring for a child up to 2 years old, or up to 3 years old if the child has a disability, are eligible for the monthly childcare support allowance.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/social-benefits-for-refugees and read the section under 'Monthly Childcare Support Allowance for Single Parents or Guardians'.

answers.answer: Applications must be submitted to the county agency for payments and social inspection or the Bucharest municipality agency, either in person or electronically, depending on where the residence is registered.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/social-benefits-for-refugees and read the section under 'Monthly Childcare Support Allowance for Single Parents or Guardians'.

answers.answer: The allowance is granted starting from the month after the application is submitted and continues until the child turns 2 years old, or 3 years old if the child has a disability.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/social-benefits-for-refugees and read the section under 'Monthly Childcare Support Allowance for Single Parents or Guardians'.

answers.answer: Ukrainian minors are eligible for free accommodation in school dormitories, a daily food allowance, and additional financial support for school supplies, bedding, clothing, and footwear.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/social-benefits-for-refugees and read the section under 'Accommodation and Allowances for Ukrainian Minors'.

answers.answer: Applications should be submitted to the local Social Assistance Directorate, and the school where the minor is enrolled might also assist; it is advisable to contact the local City Hall or Social Assistance Directorate for precise instructions.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/social-benefits-for-refugees and read the section under 'Accommodation and Allowances for Ukrainian Minors'.

answers.answer: Adults with disabilities can benefit from social services in various types of centers, including care and assistance centers, rehabilitation centers, and sheltered housing, to ensure proper integration and care.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/social-benefits-for-refugees and read the section under 'Protection of the Rights of Persons with Disabilities'.

answers.answer: To access services, adults with disabilities must establish legal status with the General Inspectorate for Immigration, register at the DGASPC, undergo an evaluation, and submit required documents like a temporary protection permit and medical report.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/social-benefits-for-refugees and read the section under 'Protection of the Rights of Persons with Disabilities'.

answers.answer: Children who are Ukrainian citizens residing in Romania, are under temporary protection, and are not beneficiaries of international protection are eligible for the state allowance.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/social-benefits-for-refugees and read the section under 'State Allowance for Children'.

answers.answer: Payments are made either by postal mandate to the domicile or residence or to a bank account if the temporary residence permit has a complete address, or only to a bank account if the address is incomplete.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/social-benefits-for-refugees and read the section under 'State Allowance for Children'.

answers.answer: The allowance is 719 RON per month for children under 2, children under 3 with a disability, and children aged 3 to 18 with disabilities; it is 292 RON per month for children aged 2 to 18 and youth over 18 enrolled in pre-university education.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/social-benefits-for-refugees and read the section under 'State Allowance for Children'.

answers.answer: Parents or representatives must submit a declaration confirming their residence every 3 months, starting from the application month, to avoid suspension of the state allowance.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/social-benefits-for-refugees and read the section under 'State Allowance for Children'.

answers.answer: Refugees under temporary protection are eligible if they worked for at least 12 of the last 24 months, were engaged in legally registered independent work with unemployment insurance, or are recent graduates at least 16 years old.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/social-benefits-for-refugees and read the section under 'Unemployment Benefits for Refugees Under Temporary Protection'.

answers.answer: Refugees under temporary protection apply by submitting their application to the local Employment Agency (ANOFM) in their area of residence.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/social-benefits-for-refugees and read the section under 'Unemployment Benefits for Refugees Under Temporary Protection'.

answers.answer: The minimum benefit amount for unemployment benefits is 660 RON per month, provided for up to 6 months.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/social-benefits-for-refugees and read the section under 'Unemployment Benefits for Refugees Under Temporary Protection'.

answers.answer: Applications for unemployment benefits must be submitted within 12 months of employment termination.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/social-benefits-for-refugees and read the section under 'Unemployment Benefits for Refugees Under Temporary Protection'.
